channel.title: ElevenRoute
channel.description: Anatoliy Yastreb's travel blog. I write here about all the places I visit and share my experiences.

item.title: San Francisco Zoo
item.description:
Our last day we spent in San Francisco and decided to visit local zoo.

Wolverine - dangerous beast.

Black bears like these cloud be spotted in the mountains nearby, but we haven't seen any :)

item.title: Lake Tahoe
item.description:
After tahoe we headed to lake Tahoe - the biggest alpine lake in North America. It's located in Sierra Nevada mountains on the border of California and Nevada at the altitude of 1,900m. During the winter it's a popular skiing resort, and a beach destination in the summer. We got here in between seasons, so there were not a lot of tourists and very reasonably priced hotels.
We started our trip on a BMW cabrio, but after a few days its roof stopped working - we couldn't get it up. We had to drive to Sacramento, where it was exchanged for a Dodge Challenger, not a cabrio this time :)
On the forest trail near to the lake we found an interesting plant - called Snow Flower. Turns out it's a parasitic plant, it attaches to the roots of the trees and steals nutrients from them.

item.title: Yosemite National Park
item.description:
Our next stop was Yosemite National Park to the north of Sequoia National Park. The most visited place in the park is Yosemite Valley: around 4-5 million visitors per year. We arrived on Saturday morning and all the parking places were already full, so we had to drive in circles for about an hour looking for a place to park.
In the late spring, the snow starts to melt in the higher mountains and powers the waterfalls. The Merced river running through the park was flooded and some areas were closed.

item.title: Highway 1 & Sequoia National Park
item.description:
Our California road-trip started in San-Francisco. We rented a car for 11 days and headed south to Sequoia National Park.
Our route was on the scenic Highway 1, but the weather wasn't great this day, so most of the time we spent in a thick fog.
There is a beach near to San-Simeon, where a lot of elephant seals live. We saw them during a period called molting. During this time the seals haul to the beach to shed their outer layer skin. This process takes about a month, during this time they just lay on a beach and do not consume any food.
By the evening we arrived to our hotel, but it turned out that Booking.com canceled our reservation and we didn't get a notice, since we didn't have any internet. We had to find a new place and drive there.
In the morning we went to Sequoia National Park. This park is famous for its giant sequoia trees. General Sherman - the biggest tree on Earth (by volume) - is locaed here. Along General Sherman neighbours are another 5 of 10 biggest trees in the world.
General Sherman. Height: 83.8 m (274.9 ft), Circumference at ground: 31.3 m (102.6 ft), weight: 1910 metric tons, estimated age: 2300-2700 years. But it's not even the oldes tree in this park, there are some trees that are around 3500 years old!

item.title: Fiji
item.description:
We spent first 3 days on the main island, Viti Levu, in a resort called Yatule. It has a nice long white beach, but unfortunately the sea was rough and there were big waves the whole time we stayed there.
After Yatule we went to our main destination - Blue Lagoon Beach Resort. It's located on the Nacula island in the chain of Yasawa islands to the north of main island. The transfer boat takes about 4.5 hours and it stops at many other resorts on the way.
The weather at Blue Lagoon was better and there were no waves, probably because it's a lagoon :)

Villas have open air bathroom

Dive boat which takes people to daily activities.

The reef in front of the resort is a great place to snorkel.

item.title: Shanghai, China
item.description:
On our way to Delhi we had a connection in Shanghai. Ukrainians can get a free 144-hour transit visa, so we decided to have a longer connections and stayed here for 2 days.
We stayed in a hotel in the city center, near to Nanjing Road - the main shopping street in town. It has lots of malls and cafes and you can have a ride in a little trolley 😀
Shanghai, as any other major Chinese city has heavy air pollution. The air quality index here goes from 150 to 400 points, while 50 is considered normal. Bellow is the view from our hotel window, it was ok on the first day, but the next days it got worse.

Cats are hanging on the trees.

Walked to the Bund waterfront.

The Oriental Pearl TV-Tower (468m) and skyscrappers in Pudong area.

Visited Yu Garden - a traditional Chinese garden, which has a giant tourist shopping center around it.

Tasted Chinese dumplings.

In the evening we wanted to walk to the waterfront and stuck in a pedestrian traffic jam. Thousands of people wandering around the street from shop to shop. The police is trying to maintain some order and directs people in one way, so you can only walk in one direction on one sidewalk.

item.title: San Francisco, California
item.description:
We went to San Francisco for a weekend. Not much has changed here since I was here last time 8 years ago 😀
We stayed in a hotel in Fisherman's Warf, not far away from Pier 39, where sea lions live. That's where we went first thing in the morning.
Not far away from Pier 39 there is the Musee Mecanique - a big collection of old mechanical arcade machines.
From the museum we walked to the Golden Gate bridge.

Golden Gate.

Crissy field park - a former airfield near to the Golden Gate bridge.

We met some gophere there.

From the Golden Gate we hiked in the park along the ocean.

Some wild mushrooms.

On the next day it was much more sun and we decided to ride a tour boat around the bay.

Alkatraz island, I was here last time.

Famous houses called Painted Ladies.

There are bisons living in the Golden Gate park.

item.title: Seattle, Washington
item.description:
After 8 years I've come to Seattle again. This time we spent here almost two weeks.
In the downtown trains and buses share the same tunnel.
We lived near to Space-Needle, close to us was the Pop-culture Museum. The building of this museum is quite interesting.

Children's playground

Chihuly glass art museum.

There are a lot of homeless people living in tents just on the streets in Seattle, same as in many other american cities.

Space-Needle is under renovation.

The weather changes rapidly. In under an hour we had a sunshine, then thunderstorm with heavy rain and sunshine again.

Walked in the downtown.

Glass spheres is the new Amazon office building.

Visited farmers market, nothing unusual here 😀

People fishing squids on the pier near to the market.

In the evening I went to 73-rd floor of the Columbia Center Observatory hoping to see a sunset. But the weather changed again and the skies were covered in clouds.

On the other day the sunset was better 😀

item.title: Denver, Colorado
item.description:
After Austin we went to Colorado, where spent a couple of days in Denver.

They have a free bus running on the main street here, taking people from one mall to another.

Christmass market, almost like in Germany.

Walk around an empty prak.

Met some well-fed squirells here.

In Denver we visited botanical garden as well.

There are christmass lights all over the trees and bushes.

Japanese garden, but it's not very exciting for us 😀

Someone has a memorial bench in the garden.

Modern art.

From Denver we went to Rocky Mountains, in a town called Estes-Park.
The nature is great here and deers are walking just in fron of the houses.

item.title: Austin, Texas
item.description:
Austin is a capital of Texas. Here we visited botanical garden.

Enormous butterflies are flying here.

After the garden we walked along the river to the downtown.

People are hanging out with their pets.

Visited the Capitol.
